author: RobWords
description:
Let's explore whether animals can talk. And go to https://ground.news/robwords to see how language shapes our perspectives. Save 40% for unlimited access to the Vantage Plan through my link.

What accent would a talking monkey have? What does an elephant saying "Margaret" sound like? Can parrots really talk? And do giraffes say anything at all?

In this episode, let's explore the language of the animal kingdom. Through looking at the latest research, you'll learn just how close to talking some species already are, and what's stopping them speaking already.

🚨ROBWORDS LIVE🚨
11th April 2026. The Bloomsbury Theatre, London.
Tickets: https://www.ucl.ac.uk/bloomsbury-theatre/events/2026/apr/evening-etymology-rob-words

🌐RESEARCH🌐
Talking macaques: https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/sciadv.1600723#supplementary-materials
Humming giraffes: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1186/s13104-015-1394-3#Sec10
Elephant names: https://warnercnr.source.colostate.edu/elephants-have-names-like-people
title: Why animals can't talk (but almost can)
